'''Mojangles''', or '''Minecraft Seven''', internally referred to as '''default''' {{in|JE}}, is the primary [[font]] used in ''Minecraft'' for in-game text. Its design has been present in all ports of the game.

As of [[Java Edition 1.21]],{{verify}} this font contains 2,426 characters.<!-- cut from Language; currently used font is outdated, do not uncomment until it has been fixed, see File:Minecraft.woff and File talk:Minecraft.woff2

== Definition ==
{{iN|JE}}, the default font references 4 files:

* {{cd|ascii.png}}
* {{cd|accented.png}}
* {{cd|nonlatin_european.png}}
* {{cd|unifont.zip}}

The final file is used as a fallback, since any character not (yet) defined in this font will use [[GNU Unifont]] instead; said font is covered on its own page.<!--
The official name of the font used in Bedrock. It is used almost everywhere. Metadata indicates it was first made by [[4J Studios]] around 2011.-->

== Supported characters ==

=== ''Java Edition'' ===
; {{cd|ascii.png}}

This contains the most-used characters and some other symbols. Its filename is a misnomer: it does not contain ''solely'' ASCII characters.
In particular:

* Glyphs {{mono|U+0020  SPACE}} through {{mono|U+007E ~ TILDE}} display the [[Wikipedia:Basic Latin|Basic Latin]] Unicode block characters; this mirrors ASCII.
* Glyphs {{mono|U+007F DELETE}} through {{mono|U+00FF Ã¿ LATIN SMALL LETTER Y WITH DIAERESIS}} display the [[Wikipedia:Code page 437|Code page 437]] characters.

Each character is drawn as an 8Ã—8 pixel image, with the [[w:en:Ascent (font)|ascent]] 7 pixels from the top. The characters are arranged in a 16Ã—16 atlas.

''Note: the font used by the wiki is incomplete and outdated, and therefore some of the more obscure characters below will not be displayed correctly.''

; {{cd|accented.png}}

This contains mostly versions of letters with accents, diacritics, or ligatures. However, it also contains some exceptions such as circled numbers and letters.

Each character is drawn as a 12Ã—9 pixel image, with the [[w:en:Ascent (font)|ascent]] 10 pixels from the top. As of [[25w04a]], the characters are arranged in a 75Ã—16 atlas. New characters expand the atlas downward. In comparison to <code>ascii.png</code>, the characters can be up to 3 px taller, 1 px lower, and 1 px wider. Due to the characters being taller than usual, the top pixels might stick out of some interfaces or overlap with text above them.<ref>{{bug|MC-133331||New font: rows are lower than letters with diacritics}}</ref>

This contains many accented characters and most of the miscellaneous symbols. Contrary to its name, it also includes characters that are non-European,<ref>{{bug|MC-199249||nonlatin_european.png contains non-European glyphs|WAI}}</ref> and some obscure Latin script characters.

Each character is drawn as a 8Ã—8 pixel image, with the ascent 7 pixels from the top. As of [[25w04a]], the characters are arranged in a 67Ã—16 atlas. New characters expand the atlas downward.

Characters {{mono|U+00C0 Ã€ LATIN CAPITAL LETTER A WITH GRAVE}} through {{mono|U+00A9 Â© COPYRIGHT SIGN}} are actually mapped to the [[wikipedia:C0_and_C1_control_codes#C0_controls|C0 control codes]] ({{mono|U+0000..U+001F}}). The {{mono|U+007F DELETE}} character is mapped to the {{mono|U+2302 âŒ‚ HOUSE}} character instead. Despite the upper two rows and âŒ‚ appearances, they are mapped to the characters {{mono|U+0000..U+001F}} and {{mono|U+007F}}. The last character is U+00A0 NO-BREAK SPACE. When using the windows ALT codes in the chat in Bedrock Edition, the resulting characters are different than they would be when used in another program, alt codes 0-255 are mapped to the characters in the default8.png image, if you convert the alt code to hex then the first digit plus 1 is the column and the second plus 1 is the row in default8.png, for example the alt code 159 is 9F in hex, and will be the character at column 10 row 16 in default8.png (Æ’). This means that typing a control character instead shows a character that is unlike the expected representation. Most fonts either show nothing, or a box with the abbreviation inside, as does GNU Unifont. The {{cd|glyph_##.png}} files reflect Java Edition's Legacy Unicode provider. The numbers in the glyph file name represent the first 2 numbers in the Unicode code, while the location in the file is the next 2 numbers. They cover characters {{mono|U+0000..U+D7AF}}, some of {{mono|U+E000..U+E1FF}}, and {{mono|U+F900..U+FFFF}}.

There exist 2 [[Wikipedia:Private Use Areas|Private Use Area]] sheets: {{code|glyph_E0.png|glyph_E1.png}}. {{mono|E0}} contains glyphs for control icons, such as {{Xbutton|onea}} and {{Nsbutton|dpad-right}}. {{mono|E1}} contains glyphs for miscellaneous icons, including the minecoin and [[Agent]] icon. E0 characters are categorized in {{cd|emoticons.json}}.<ref>https://github.com/TwistedAsylumMC/bedrock-unicode-characters</ref>

Other versions of the font file are obtainable through other means:
* A file called {{code|minecraft.ttf}} can be found in versions of [[Pocket Edition]] from [[Pocket Edition v0.8.0 alpha build 2|v0.8.0 alpha build 2]] to [[Pocket Edition v0.10.4 alpha|v0.10.4 alpha]]; it can be obtained via opening the apk file as though it were a zip or jar file, and removed from the archive accordingly.
* The Mojangles font file used by Bedrock Edition can be found at {{code|C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.MinecraftUWP\data\fonts}} on Windows, however permissions for the WindowsApps folder will need to be adjusted as to permit access.

== Trivia ==
* The name is closely similar to that of Bojangles.
* The general typographic design has been present in many previous games by [[Markus Persson]], such as [[Legend of the Chambered]].
* According to the ''Bedrock Edition'' Chat Settings and the ''Bedrock Edition'' game files, the name of the font used by ''Bedrock Edition'' is called "Mojangles".
* According to [[Java Edition 1.13-pre6]], the name of the font used by Java Edition is called "Minecraft Seven".
* The characters U+00B8 CEDILLA {{cd|Â¸}} and U+0327 COMBINING CEDILLA {{cd|â—ŒÌ§}} used to be swapped. 
* The [[New Nintendo 3DS Edition]]'s font is a combination of the pre-1.12 JE font<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20251228183848/https://dafontstyle.com/download/minecraft-font-style.html</ref> and some select characters from GNU Unifont. In addition, the {{mono|Â®}} sign was changed.
